website_summaries.verdict: Those needing an active chair for the classroom should check out this model specifically designed for classroom learning.
pros: Comes in a variety of different colors
Offers antimicrobial protection for classroom settings
Available for purchase in a variety of different heights
cons: Does not have a non-slip base, making the chair slippery on wooden surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought the 16” for 2nd grader
customer_reviews.text: These are great but I wish I would have bought the larger size. My 2nd grader is wiggle worm ADHD and normal sized kid. Purchased the 14” and regret not getting the 16”. This is the best price I have found. Purchased gray based on our previous teachers request that the chair not be a distraction or object of envy to other classmates. My sons prior teacher had one for each student and the kids loved them. I wish all teachers used them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: As a fourth grade teacher, I was SO excited to have these in my classroom, but, after only two years of use, the middle of the wobble stools have come up through the top, making it very UNCOMFORTABLE for students to sit on them. For the price, I am extremely disappointment as they should have lasted longer, especially since my students took such good care of them.
customer_reviews.author: Alley

customer_reviews.title: Only used for four months and cracked.
customer_reviews.text: Chair has been used by fourth graders this year for four months... the seat has cracked. Students love them, I purchased 5 others and have not had a problem yet. Would like to get this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Great for speech therapy room
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these for my speech therapy room in a public school. I serve a variety of children, and having a variety of seating options is fantastic. The kids can wiggle at the table and still focus on our activities and therapy. The first couple of days drove me crazy, but setting the ground rules, the kids now know what the expectations are when on the stools: "you can wiggle, you can wobble, but you don't spin around!" :)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Wiggle While You Read!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted to purchase Wobble Chairs for a long time. A colleague and myself realized this would be the perfect addition to our classrooms of first graders. It's been shown that in performing well while reading and doing math, that students that move are able to attend to the learning better. The four chairs I purchased move easily and are very comfortable. The chairs are well constructed and will last many years. The items arrived on time as promised and I look forward to having my students enjoy them as they learn!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my younger son who has a learning disability and fidgets all the time. This product has a few things going against it. First this didn't help with my child fidgeting. Second is that it is made out of poor quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Elfant

customer_reviews.title: what's the warranty, made in USA!
customer_reviews.text: less than 1 year old, my 9 year old uses it at her desk (turned 10 in may 2019), already cracking at the base??? cheap plastic, I'd like another for free please!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great for a child on the spectrum
customer_reviews.text: I order the 16" junior chair for a 4th grade classroom. It arrived fairly quickly considering there was a weekend and a holiday right after I ordered. It has worked well to help a child on the spectrum focus, but should be used on carpet or a rug. Originally it was used on tile and it kept sliding. A small rug made a world of difference and suddenly it stayed in place and he was able to focus on his school work. It was easy to assemble. Time will tell if once the novelty wears off if it will continue to help, but so far it has been worth the money and an asset to the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: but our pre-schoolers love this seat
customer_reviews.text: We accidentally ordered the wrong size, but our pre-schoolers love this seat. The larger version is a favorite in our classroom, and I wish we could have more of them, so the students would not have to take turns, using the three we have. Especially students that have a hard time sitting still for more than five minutes are very happy, and able to focus on the lesson, rather than spending their energy on trying to sit still in a chair.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Herms

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep you focused while at the desk.
customer_reviews.text: So we got this for our kid's room, and they like it a lot. It is virtually indestructible, and if you have a kid that likes to lean back on chairs, then this is the chair that will break that habit. Lean too far and you will be on the ground. The only downside is that it is not comfortable to sit in, that is it needs a cushion if you plan on sitting for any long periods of time. This is great for strengthing your core muscles.... after using it for about 3 weeks we saw improvements in our back pain (back pain went away).
customer_reviews.author: McAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Tears up floor
customer_reviews.text: These stools are tearing up and discoloring my linoleum floors in my classroom. Unfortunately, I bought six. Good for use on carpet only!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Woohoo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is 7. She is constantly moving around in the chair and leaning all about as we do homework. I got this for her to be able to still move but focus as well. She hasn't used it for that yet, tonight will be the first but the girls ranted and raved about it when it came because they have them in school. I sat on it and spun and i'm not going to lie.. it was fun ;P
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my wiggle worm of a son
customer_reviews.text: My son is a jitter bug. He *can* sit still, but he'd rather have some freedom to move. I bought this hoping it would help him through his Zooms this year since the end of last school year was pretty rough. My son is painfully shy on Zoom, and even with his video off, he is uncomfortable sometimes. This stool lets him work off some of his anxious energy, and I truly credit it as one of the reasons this year is going so much better than last so far.
customer_reviews.author: monniewolf

customer_reviews.title: Wobbling Away the Hours
customer_reviews.text: We bought the wobble chair after our son’s first grade teacher recommended it for the whole class. It is amazing to see how simple constant motion allows him to concentrate. I thought it would be a distraction, but it truly helps. She set a few rule (no spinning, etc.) and the kids sat and the motion is pretty much unconscious. It just works for such active bodies. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: H. B. Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The chair is great when it’s working. We used it for 2 weeks and then one day my kid fell from the chair with it dissambled. The rubbles around the pole have already worn out (after two weeks!) and could not hold the chair anymore. Will return it.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it. . .but I don't understand how they're so expensive
customer_reviews.text: If it were up to me, these would be 3 stars because they do the job, but I can't believe they are so expensive. They are literally 3 pieces of tough plastic you put together. For the cost, I expected more. HOWEVER, my students love these things more than any other stool They flock to class to be the first ones in so they can use them. It's bizarre, and pretty cool. They're light and kids can easily put them up on the tables after class (but that lightness means you frequently have to remind them to avoid high sticking when carrying them around the classroom).
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: First Grade Favorite
customer_reviews.text: These work great at my first graders’ desks. Just enough wiggle and easy enough to balance by turning them over when kids are getting too wiggly. These were a replacement item for a Donors Choose Project and I like these much more than the ones I originally signed up for. Will get more if we have the funds!
customer_reviews.author: Rtemp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, simple design
customer_reviews.text: Now that we are "home schooling" I needed a better option for my squirrel kids. I found these had the best reviews across different websites. It came in a small, light weight box. It's 3 pieces - top, bottom and the post. It took seconds to assemble. I got the 16" one which is the right size for my 1st grader but turns out is a littl too low for our kitchen table. Trying to figure how the right table height for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kate B.

customer_reviews.title: Great at home desk option
customer_reviews.text: My son used these at school and really enjoyed them. I got one for his desk at home and he is thrilled. Shipped quickly and super easy "assembly". He is in 6th grade and 54inches tall...the 18inch is perfect with some growing room.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Great concept and my girls really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, the price is a bit high for me but still wanted to give it a try because my girls fidget constantly when doing homework or even eating a meal. Unfortunately, the desk we bought it for the 17" which was too short for her and she would outgrow it in a few months, both my daughters really liked it. However, wasn't worth it for me to keep. Deciding to buy the adjustable one that will grow with them just the price is where I hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has to move constantly. It was preventing her from finishing school work. This chair helped. I had previously tried a wobbly cushion but it was not effective.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Work well in my 2nd Grade Classroom
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gotten 4 of these stools so far for my second grade classroom. I keep them at my small group table. My students and I really do love them. They are able to wiggle while still being able to work and they’ve held up well so far. I do think they are a little pricey, but compared to a lot of other flexible seating options it could be worse.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Selin

customer_reviews.title: durable- measure height needed before purchase to ensure correct height
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sturdy wiggle seats for my hyperactive students. Helps 3/4 of them to be able to wiggle and work at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Keesee

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. These arrived quickly & assemble much easier than ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. These arrived quickly & assemble much easier than I expected! I'll let you guys know how they hold up in my 3rd grade classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Use extreme caution when using.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return them because I found them dangerous. There is no slip resistance on the top of the seat and the bottom is so curved that children can easily fall off of them. I would never purchase them for classroom or individual use.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Hall

customer_reviews.title: great chair
customer_reviews.text: my 6 yr old nephew loved it from the start! a great chair for a kid who wants to move around while needing to concentrate. will see how it works when he begins 1st grade
customer_reviews.author: karenp

customer_reviews.title: These wobble chairs work wonderfully in our first grade classroom
customer_reviews.text: These wobble chairs work wonderfully in our first grade classroom. They are easy to put together and take apart. They are the "just right" height for my 6 and 7 year olds who sit at tables. I realized after they arrived that you can flip them over and sit on them and they are flat and don't wobble, so students can choose what works best for them. The lighter colored stools do start to get marked up a bit on the bottom from dirt etc. but other than that, these are such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen A. Phinney

customer_reviews.title: Very functional where there is limited space.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these because we have limited space and they fit nicely under our table when they are not in use. Also, more people can sit at the table because of the size of the stools. Our grandchildren love them. I wondered if the younger grandchildren may try to climb up on them and if they may be a safety hazard but that has not been an issue at all. We haven't had any problem with them coming apart as was mentioned in another review. We are thrilled with them. They are very pricey but they fill a nitch and so they were worth it to me. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stools for school
customer_reviews.text: I can't wait to use them at school. My kids are wiggly and these hopefully will do the trick and have them be able to sit at a table!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great for wiggly remote learner!
customer_reviews.text: My son had one of these, bought by his teacher, in kindergarten. I knew it would be difficult to sit in a static chair, all day, to remote learn in 4th grade. I happened to find they come in pre-teen size and he loves it! Let's him move around and still concentrate on class. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: I am a kindergarten teacher with a very high energy class. This is the second stool that I have ordered. The biggest recommendation that I would give: give clear rules on who is to use the stool and clear rules on how it is to be used.
customer_reviews.author: sara karch thompson

customer_reviews.title: Carefully consider your child’s acceptance level.
customer_reviews.text: My child is on the spectrum. She is afraid to sit on this chair. I am hoping that she adjusts. Doesn’t seem likely. Some children may like it. Some will not. Use your gage for your child’s personality and preferences before purchasing is my suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Jomo9

customer_reviews.title: It helped contain the movement of 3 year old and helped 6 year old concentrate better as he was able to move in one spot
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my 3 and 6 years old grandsons. It was a hit for their birthdays. It helped contain the movement of 3 year old and helped 6 year old concentrate better as he was able to move in one spot.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Sort of a review
customer_reviews.text: I can not give an accurate review until the wobble chair is used for awhile. It seems sturdy enough, time will tell. I think, while it is a good concept, it is way too expensive. So many children could benefit but as I read reviews, it would be very hard to buy more than one, as this was really hard for me as I am retired. The delivery was terrible as the delivery man could not find the place even with exact instructions. Three attempts and I had to walk out to find him wandering about trying to find my condo number. So.....
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: great for my wiggly kid
customer_reviews.text: My kid will do anything but sit on his behind in a chair - with online learning, we were looking for some alternative seating to help focus him and keep him from getting hurt. This stool helps a lot! And he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: lydaalexander

customer_reviews.title: Great stools for busy bodies!
customer_reviews.text: These stools are such a fabulous seating option for my kindergarten students. They are sturdy with just the right amount of wobble. They are durable enough to last a long time. These great stools are worth every penny they cost. Think of it as an investment in engagement for busy bodied learners!
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great for the wiggle's!
customer_reviews.text: This product is being used for my students to use as flexible seating in the classroom in place of the traditional chair. School had not yet started but I have had great success with them in previous classes. I presume this year will be no different. I planon getting more of this product in the future for my students and classroom so all students can use one!
customer_reviews.author: Katie D.

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love Them
customer_reviews.text: These are great for Pre-K and Kindergarten. I got the small size. Use for only about 15-20 minutes per session, for best results.
customer_reviews.author: marie schoenacker

customer_reviews.title: I had one and the kids love it so much I requested two more
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my second grade classroom. I had one and the kids love it so much I requested two more. The are fairly stable. The kids only fall over if they're tipping it too far just as they would in any chair. I use the 14 inch for my second graders and it is the perfect size. A colleague bought the 16 inch and she says it is too big for her students.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on other chairs.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these and it’s funny when they fall off of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE CHAIRS!
customer_reviews.text: In almost every classroom in my building there is at least one Kore wobble chair. I teach special education and the kids I have were so fidgety in normal chairs. I decided to get some for my classroom and what a difference they have made.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It has held up well and works wonderfully with my students
customer_reviews.text: I use this item daily in my classroom and have for over a year. It has held up well and works wonderfully with my students. I love that they can wiggle and move without disturbing the rest of the class.
customer_reviews.author: Sissi

customer_reviews.title: Popular with students
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, student love them and made of good quality. I wish I could afford one for every student. I ordered 6 for small group reading. Students do wiggle but stay engaged in lesson.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fitting the requirements
customer_reviews.text: A Hokki chair was recommended for my son because he always has extra energy. This was our first attempt at this and it seems to be working well for him in his class room. They are advising he prefers to sit on this chair rather than his stationary chair. He also has been able to focus a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: ArisMomma

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids with autism!
customer_reviews.text: My ASD kiddo LOVES this chair! Highly recommend for Autism families!
customer_reviews.author: Deuces wild

customer_reviews.title: What a great investment. I'm a teacher and my students absolutely ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great investment. I'm a teacher and my students absolutely LOVE these wobble chairs. It is important to demonstrate how to use these chairs properly (the bottom is not a flat surface), but I've found it helps my students concentrate as they like to work while being in motion. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Allows movement while still quiet
customer_reviews.text: Love that these were easy to assemble! Students now have a quiet way to move while remaining in their work spaces. Wobble chair is a win!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Leigh Lang

customer_reviews.title: This is probably the best thing I have ever ordered
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best thing I have ever ordered. I bought this for my grandson and he loves it.. I would highly recommend this for any child who is dealing with add/adhd. i also think that these should be in every classroom and available to all children. They are wonderful!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Helps the kiddos pay attention
customer_reviews.text: Bought 21 of these for my sons fidgety first grade class. The students took right to them and the teacher has noticed an improvement in attention and behavior. Success! They are definitely institutional grade construction. Highly recommend these to anyone with a squirmy kid.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: It's also very sturdy so it won't bend or break
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the wobble chair for my 12 year old son because he couldn't sit still in class. This chair really worked for him! The chair is not flat on the bottom so it wobbles back and forth while sitting on it. It's also very sturdy so it won't bend or break! His teachers reported that he was able to focus more in class because he was not distracted by trying to sit still in a regular chair. The wobble chair got him through his middle school years! I highly recommend this chair for anyone who has problems sitting still.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wobble Well
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to move and he loves this stool. He uses it for almost all the time. I like that this fits teens. Provides movement, core activation and seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Martin

customer_reviews.title: The kids love the stools
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these stools for my classroom, just to try. I have some students that really struggle to sit and chair tipping (and sometimes falling) is common. The kids love the stools, and honestly, I have tried them, even though they are too short for me, and I like them too. I plan to buy some more for my classroom so kids have a choice. The only drawback that I have found is that they like to spin on them, too. No spinning allowed or they lose their privilege of using the stool.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Kidder

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for the Classroom
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Really helps my student with ADHD/Sensory issues. He has learned how to spin in this and it gives him the movement that he needs to stay calm and focused.
customer_reviews.author: in10sitty

customer_reviews.title: ADHD kids can learn better!
customer_reviews.text: I am a physician and a school board member. I purchased this for our children at school with ADHD. It has changed their world! By simply moving, their ability to learn has increased by 10 fold. We have a sponsor who will be donating more to our school because the seat has made such a difference. It makes NO noise while they wiggle. Our teachers were begging to be the first to try it. It also fits nicely up to a desk and doesn't take up extra space. I HIGHLY recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tcl

customer_reviews.title: Wobble Chair a positive factor
customer_reviews.text: The wobble chair is working well in the classroom. It provides the activity/movement needed by students without distraction for others.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for my student who needed it
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for my student who needed it. Helped him stay focused and able to wiggle around without being distracting.
customer_reviews.author: aella8

customer_reviews.title: Great Chairs for Primary Classroom
customer_reviews.text: Great chairs for my First Grade Classroom. I am utilizing flexible seating in my room. This will work great for my kids who struggle with sitting still. Thank-you!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Zimmermann

customer_reviews.title: Great for distance-learning teen who needs movement and attention
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Bought this (largest size) for my distance-learning teenager who is sitting at the dining room table all day. He needed more movement and better posture than a dining room chair provides. It’s very comfortable - I like sitting on it when I get a chance. He sits on it all day and has from day one without one word about it. No more lying on the table like before. Great purchase. Hope it holds up - if it makes it through this school year I’ll consider it a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: SPTX

customer_reviews.title: but made in USA is a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my students to share in my classroom. They are loving it. It's not quite as tall as I was expecting, but it serves its purpose well. I will try to get more since I have many students in my class and only two wobble chairs so far. Wish they were a bit cheaper, but made in USA is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: sara taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great for child with sensory and autism
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about this chair. Our son struggles with being able to attend and focus. He’s so sensory driven and with this lockdown he’s struggled with regulating his sensory needs. I bought this as a recommendation from his OT. We saw a difference with the first use. Sometimes we pair with a balance board if he needs extra help. Don’t hesitate it’s a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Avon

customer_reviews.title: ... these chairs through Donor's Choose and my students instantly loved them. They would have received 5 stars from ...
customer_reviews.text: I received these chairs through Donor's Choose and my students instantly loved them. They would have received 5 stars from me, but they tend to slip out from under students when used on bare floor. They grip much better on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: tina cozby

customer_reviews.title: Best seats for my Kinders!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a kindergarten teacher and I love these wobble seats! My kiddos that need to constantly move work SO much better with these seats. They are very sturdy and durable. The kids like to spin on the seats but they just need to be reminded to keep their feet flat on the ground while sitting on them. Overall though, I again highly recommend these!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stool for ALL ages!
customer_reviews.text: My 65 year old mother just used this for one of our library painting classes and loved it. I was shocked because she is picky. I used it and loved it. For bigger people too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size. Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Good size. Easy assembly, however, the seat has no grip. Pretty easy to slip off, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: The stools are amazing. Not only are they sitting with proper posture ...
customer_reviews.text: I teach Early Childhood Special Education classes. Children often do not have the core body strength to sit on the carpet as well as the impulse control to stay in one place. The stools are amazing. Not only are they sitting with proper posture but with the different sizes all of the children have a good fit. Many of the primary and secondary teachers have borrowed a few for their wigglers as well. They are finding that the stools are much more manageable than the therapy balls which roll around the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: Kid didn't like it. I didn't like how it doesn't have good padding on the seat or on the bottom. I ordered a similar chair by Learniture that does have the padding and overall has sturdier construction. Happy with that one...returned this one.
customer_reviews.author: Customer X

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but kid is happy
customer_reviews.text: I think its pricey for what it is, but my son bought it with his own $ and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ACB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first wobble chair for my granddaughter for Christmas and sent it to school with her. Then decided to purchase one for my grandson, and sent it to school. This chair is a wonderful gift for the child that can't sit still, it keeps them in their seat and allows for the movement they need. I wish they had these when I was teaching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together unlike most things
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together unlike most things. Literally you just fit it together, no screws or anything needed. I toppled over right on my back when I attempted to sit on it, my kids had a good laugh at me. They love their chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymie

customer_reviews.title: First-Grader-Approved!
customer_reviews.text: My students LOVE these! They wiggle while they work all day long! ;-) They were easy to put together, and they're light enough for the students to put up on the tables at the end of the day. I've been using them for over a month and have had no complaints or issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli K

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. Durable. Love the colors. The children love them!
customer_reviews.author: JBR

customer_reviews.title: I would love to purchase a class set
customer_reviews.text: This chair is the hottest commodity in my classroom! I would love to purchase a class set, hoping to find a grant to cover it. Very sturdy, and truly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: farmfarm

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected. Expensive plastic...
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. I understand the purpose of this chair but I did not expect it to be so flimsy I am appalled at the $$ I spent on this. Besides the fact it’s about 2-4 inches to short for my son and based on measurements I went with the junior even though it said 8-9 and he’s 7 cause I wanted him to grow with it a little. He can barely reach his desk. Just a huge waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Madkat

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for flexible seating
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for my daughter’s classroom and it is great. She had purchased this item herself in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your wiggle worms
customer_reviews.text: The stool works VERY well for my 6 year old who can not sit still! She loves her “wiggle chair”! There were some issues with shipping/the order being cancelled but I contacted the seller and they responded right away and got the stool shipped the very next day.
customer_reviews.author: Glam_Mom79

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son, who is a constant wiggle-worm when sitting down to do homework. He loves this stool and now will sit at his desk doing homework, building Lego sets, etc., with much more focus and less restlessness. I definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: HollyRN

customer_reviews.title: Useful for kids with a lot of energy.
customer_reviews.text: I’m an 8th grade science teacher and I have 6 wobble chairs in my room. They are all used every class. The kids love them. It would be good if there was a bit of cushion on the top but the kids don’t seem to mind. I also noticed that the floor gets scratched up by the chair. The custodian pointed that out to me. I bought the first chair myself and then put in a grant for the other five as they are pricey. All in all, I’m happy with them and recommend them if you have kids with a lot of energy.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Iaciofano

customer_reviews.title: My students love this chair
customer_reviews.text: My students love this chair. It’s pretty wobbly and helps them stay focused. So easy to put together and stores nicely. I have the 18’ for middle schoolers, and I was worried it was going to be too small, but works great with the tables we have. My only complaint is it seems way to expensive for what it is- 3 pieces of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair for small kid keeping correct posture
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these chairs after seeing it at a local elementary school. Liked the chair a lot and it seems to force the kid maintaining correct posture- otherwise it will be difficult to keep the balance and sit. Bit pricy though given its simple material and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Great for my classroom!
customer_reviews.text: These stools are awesome! I love that my students can wobble and rock, and they are learning to not just spin around in them because they can. They tuck under tables and desks and leave the room looking open and tidy. No more chair legs to knock my shins like the usual chairs often do when the kids tilt and rock. The colors are great and fun. Pre-Teen stools were perfect for my average size 4th graders.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my son
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my son! He has inattentive adhd and likes to sit on his feet, this chair was a perfect match for him!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids, esp ansy ones.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old daughter loves it! She’s begging me not to return it (wanted a pink but doesn’t come in pink) purple is still a gorgeous color.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Marie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 16” Wobble Chair for 5th Grade Student
customer_reviews.text: The 5th grade student using this loves it! I got the 16” and it is not too high. It could have been 17”-18” depending on how much he grows this year. This is the boy who was running around my classroom before he had this wobble chair. Now he sits during the lesson and happily wobbles on his wobble chair!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Saved this parents knees
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because our knees were tired of being in the floor with our little one ALL the time. This easily holds my 200lb man body and let's me lean in to be closer to his level. Perfect for us!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Two already cracked and broke on seat
customer_reviews.text: After less than 1.5 years, two of the seats cracked around the circumference seam and cracked at the center of the seat. They are very uncomfortable and come apart easily. MANY better options out there by different manufacturers
customer_reviews.author: Jennnifer  R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great seat
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my grandson who is autistic he loves it he can wiggle all he wants
customer_reviews.author: ladyj

customer_reviews.title: Conforme flexible chairs
customer_reviews.text: I got this chairs for my students . They are in love with them. And help me to keep them focus and on their seat instead of jumping all over the place. Thanks to this chairs my kids are more comfortable and focused .
customer_reviews.author: zuleyka

customer_reviews.title: ... grandson was recently diagnosed with ADHD and the Doctor recommended this item
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was recently diagnosed with ADHD and the Doctor recommended this item. It's great for him, he can wiggle all he needs to.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Reuter

customer_reviews.title: Great for wiggly kiddos
customer_reviews.text: My son has trouble sitting still and doing homework and this chair allows him to wiggle while he focuses. He uses it to play Minecraft on the PS4 as well. He likes to spin with it too. Love this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Saannette

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are terrific! My son's 1st grade class had a couple, and the parents were asked to donate 1 (or more) if they wanted, so more of the kids could use them. We brought in 4 and the kids went wild they love them so much. The teachers say they help keep the wiggly kids focused and in their seats, and that engaging your body while learning helps the learning process. We ordered a green one for home too - unfortunately I didn't realize they came in so many colors until after I bought the 4 school ones or I would have branched out beyond blue!
customer_reviews.author: shopper mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my first grade students
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my first grade students. This chair has been used daily in the class by multiple students and has held up well. I would definitely purchase this wobble chair again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good one but small so returned.
customer_reviews.text: It was good but probably small for my 5 year old. Realized even the taller one wouldn’t have lasted long as he is growing tall a little faster. Otherwise a good one to buy for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Wobble away...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little chair. My special needs child adores this little wobble chair and spends more time on it than any other seating option we give her. She is a mover and likes to run amock whenever the urge strikes that is lessoned when she uses this chair. I am sure, with more practice, she will be able to stay seated long enough to complete more than one assignment. It is the perfect height for her at 4 ft tall.
customer_reviews.author: SowiloStudios

customer_reviews.title: Active son can move in class and get work done.
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this at school he's in second grade. His name he is active and so this helps him stay focused on his work and yet still be able to move. A few other kids have this type of chair in the class. The price for the chair more than we would normally pay for a chair but it seems to help. So it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gonz85

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy, just enough of a wobble for concentration.
customer_reviews.text: My students run for these stools. The are just wobbly enough to help them concentrate, not rocking them all over the place. The color is gorgeous. I am happy with them and will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: SonshineDD

customer_reviews.title: Let’s wobble!
customer_reviews.text: Study and good for elementary school. Bought this at the recommendation of her teacher and works perfectly in the classroom. Would buy again and recommend both product and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Colt's mom

customer_reviews.title: Comes in 3 pieces that goes together in less than ...
customer_reviews.text: Comes in 3 pieces that goes together in less than one minute and stays together. The student that I purchased this for loves it and it has helped him settle greatly.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: My students in my 5th grade class LOVE these!! These are our most used chairs! It's also good for those wiggling kids. 😀 They were easy to put together...I was 8 months pregnant and got them together just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ruins floors
customer_reviews.text: Ruins the wax on the classroom floors! Can’t use without a carpet pad underneath. They also make noise against hard flour compared to other stools. No rubber base or protection for floors on bottom of stool.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Wahl

customer_reviews.title: It's a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the middle sized one for a 7 year old. It's way too small. I didn't unbox it in time to return it. I don't think their sizes are accurate. The seat is too small too.
customer_reviews.author: PMR

product_meta.title: Kore Wobble Chair - Flexible Seating Stool for Toddlers, Age Range 2-3, Now with Antimicrobial Protection - Red (10in tall)
product_meta.description:
Size:Toddler (10in tall)| Color:RedIntroducing the PATENTED KORE Wobble Chair! - The Chair that really Rocks!

Proudly made in the U.S.A.

Kore chairs meet or exceed all child safety requirements for every state including California and Massachusetts.

"The KORE Chair is NOT just a piece of furniture...It's a LIFE-Changer for active kids, kids with ADHD and Autistic kids...Aggressive wobbling on a KORE Chair increases blood flow to the brain and thereby quiets the requirement for fidgety kids to move. Kids learn better and are more productive. The kid who may be considered "un-teachable" is now able to learn!"

Features:

 * FUN - homework, drawing, eating and playing video/board games are no longer sedentary activities
 * SAFE - can't tip over
 * Colorful choices make it a good fit for any room
 * Ideal for children with ADD or ADHD; provides an outlet for restlessness and extra energy
 * 275 lb. weight limit

Awards:



 * Academics' Choice Award 2013
 * Family Choice Award 2014
 * GEI Special product search and review award 2015

Youngsters have never liked to sit still, but until now there hasn't been a place for them to sit that allows them to be their energetic selves. The ingenious Kore Wobble Stool design gently rolls with your child's natural movements, so he or she stays supported and comfortable while they wiggle around on their stool. Ordinary chairs and stools force growing bodies into unnatural, static positions that are uncomfortable and don't help your child's posture. Kids can sit, wiggle, and fidget on this nifty chair while intuitively exercising their back muscles and working out their restless energy in comfort and support.
feature_bullets: IMPROVE POSTURE | The Kore Wobble Chair transforms the conventional seat into a playground for your child's imagination. Encouraging active sitting and allowing one's knees, hips and back to find comfortable and ever-changing positions
SUPERIOR FOCUS | Continuous movement while sitting relaxes the right side of the brain, leading to better focus. Helps people that are diagnosed with all forms of ADD, ADHD, and Autism
ENERGY OUTLET | By Increasing secondary focus the Kore Wobble Chair provides an outlet to move around without distracting other students or co-workers.

SAFE | A patented anti-roll safety ring on the base prevents tip-overs and falls. The gentle-rounded base is stable, moves with child and rests naturally upright. Ideal for all children thanks to fixed height options ranging from 10" to 18.7"
MADE in the USA | Proudly American - All plastic Kore Wobble Chairs are manufactured in the USA. Kore Wobble Chairs are available in all 50 states, Canada and Europe. Kore offers a LIFETIME WARRANTY!
